objects.name: NCSC
objects.description: The United Kingdom's National Cyber Security Centre, identified as the author and publisher of this report and author of the included YARA rules.

objects.name: C2 domain
objects.description: Primary Command and Control (C2) domain for Devil Bait malware operations.

objects.name: C2 URL for downloading second stage
objects.description: Hardcoded URL used to retrieve second-stage VBScript during the malware execution.

objects.name: C2 URL for exfiltration
objects.description: URL used by Devil Bait for exfiltrating stolen data to the attacker.

objects.name: C2 URL for beaconing
objects.description: URL contacted by scheduled task (AhnlabUpdate) for beaconing to attacker infrastructure.

objects.name: Malicious URL embedded in document
objects.description: Malicious URL embedded in the Word document, used for additional remote code execution.

objects.name: Malicious domain embedded in document
objects.description: Domain contained in the document for remote execution of code as described in report.

objects.name: First-stage VBScript written to disk (version.xml)
objects.description: VBScript file written by first stage macro to disk and executed, enabling infection chain.

objects.name: System enumeration output file
objects.description: File containing collected system data for later exfiltration by malware.

objects.name: Encoded system enumeration data
objects.description: File containing base64-encoded system data prepared for exfiltration.

objects.name: Malicious Microsoft Word document
objects.description: Macro-enabled Word document delivering the Devil Bait malware infection chain.
objects.pattern: [file:name = '체불확인원-김보라.doc' AND file:parent_directory_ref.path LIKE '(unknown or generic download directory)']

objects.name: Malicious VBScript payload
objects.description: Second-stage VBScript file downloaded from C2 server, observed in sandbox analysis.

objects.name: Registry modification to prevent IE first run customization
objects.description: Registry key modified by embedded VBScript for browser manipulation and user deception.

objects.name: Registry modification to prevent IE default check
objects.description: Registry key modified by embedded VBScript to suppress default browser check.

objects.name: Indicator for Malicious Word doc hash (체불확인원-김보라.doc) (MD5)
objects.description: MD5 hash of the Devil Bait macro-enabled Word document (first-stage payload).

objects.name: Indicator for Malicious Word doc hash (체불확인원-김보라.doc) (SHA1)
objects.description: SHA-1 hash of the Devil Bait macro-enabled Word document (first-stage payload).

objects.name: Indicator for Malicious Word doc hash (체불확인원-김보라.doc) (SHA256)
objects.description: SHA-256 hash of the Devil Bait macro-enabled Word document (first-stage payload).

objects.name: Indicator for Malicious VBScript hash (data.txt) (MD5)
objects.description: MD5 hash of the malicious second-stage VBScript observed in sandbox (data.txt).

objects.name: Indicator for Malicious VBScript hash (data.txt) (SHA1)
objects.description: SHA-1 hash of the malicious second-stage VBScript observed in sandbox (data.txt).

objects.name: Indicator for Malicious VBScript hash (data.txt) (SHA256)
objects.description: SHA-256 hash of the malicious second-stage VBScript observed in sandbox (data.txt).

objects.name: devil bait
objects.description: Devil Bait is a malicious macro-enabled Microsoft Word document targeting Korean speakers, which downloads and executes a second-stage VBScript. The malware uses built-in Windows binaries for execution, system enumeration, registry modification, and persistence. Devil Bait communicates with its command and control (C2) infrastructure via HTTP, collects system data, exfiltrates it, and establishes persistence through scheduled tasks masquerading as legitimate software (notably using names like 'AhnlabUpdate'). Multiple malicious documents and VBScripts are used in distinct attack stages, employing techniques such as masquerading and living off the land binaries.

objects.name: 체불확인원-김보라.doc
objects.description: A malicious macro-enabled Microsoft Word document that initiates the first stage of Devil Bait infection, responsible for downloading and executing a second-stage VBScript. It leverages embedded macros to execute malicious code when the user enables content.

objects.name: data.txt
objects.description: A malicious VBScript file retrieved from C2 and executed as the second stage of Devil Bait infection. It collects and exfiltrates system data, modifies registry settings, and establishes persistence through scheduled tasks.

objects.name: Kimsuky
objects.description: Kimsuky is referenced as a threat actor previously known to use techniques identified in Devil Bait, such as masquerading as AhnLab for persistence and using 'Update' in autorun names. The report suggests a possible link in TTPs but does not directly attribute Devil Bait to this group.

objects.name: T1059
objects.description: Devil Bait uses the WScript shell from within other scripts to spawn cmd.exe instances to collect system information.

objects.name: T1053.005
objects.description: Devil Bait creates a Scheduled Task to beacon every 10 minutes.

objects.name: T1071.001
objects.description: Devil Bait Command and Control is achieved over HTTP using the scripting object ServerXMLHTTP.

objects.name: T1041
objects.description: Devil Bait sends system enumeration data over HTTP to the C2 server.

objects.name: T1036.004
objects.description: Devil Bait masquerades as AhnLab, a legitimate security product, in its persistence mechanism.

objects.name: DevilBait_vbscript_2
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.
objects.pattern:
rule DevilBait_vbscript_2 {
    meta:
        author = "NCSC"
        description = "These strings appear in second stage VBScript used
by Devil Bait."

    strings:
       $ = "WScript.Shell" nocase
       $ = "Scripting.FileSystemObject" nocase
       $ = "MSXML2.ServerXMLHTTP.6.0" nocase
       $ = "FolderExists" nocase
       $ = "certutil" nocase
       $ = "vbCrLf" nocase
       $ = "expandenvironmentstrings" nocase
       $ = "%appdata%" nocase
    condition:

    filesize < 20KB and all of them

}

objects.name: DevilBait_Maldoc
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.
objects.pattern:
rule DevilBait_Maldoc {
    meta:
        author = "NCSC"
        description = "These strings appear in the Devil Bait malicious
document."

    strings:

   $word = "MSWordDoc"
   $ms_xml = "MSXML2.ServerXMLHTTP.6.0"
   $ = {53 65 6E 64 3A 45 78 65 63 75 74 65 28 [1-6] 2E 72 65 73 70

6F 6E 73 65 54 65 78 74 29}// Send:Execute(<variable>.responseText)

   $ = "wscript.exe //e:vbscript"

    condition:

    all of them

}

objects.name: DevilBait_C2
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.
objects.pattern:
rule DevilBait_C2 {
    meta:
        author = "NCSC"
        description = "C2 and IoC strings found in Devil Bait second
stage vbscript."

    strings:
       $file_1 = "sr011.xml"

       $must_func = "Roller"
       $must_C2 = ".co.kr"

       $c2_1 = "cross.php"
       $c2_2 = "report.php"
       $c2_3 = "list.php"
       $c2_4 = "show.php"
    condition:
        $file_1 and any of ($must_*) and any of ($c2_*)
}

objects.name: DevilBait_vbscript_1
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.
objects.pattern:
rule DevilBait_vbscript_1 {
    meta:
        author = "NCSC"
        description = "This rule identifies the first stage vbscript
written to disk e.g. version.xml."

    strings:
        $must_1 = "On Error Resume Next:Set"
        $must_2 = "CreateObject(\"MSXML2.ServerXMLHTTP.6.0\"):"
        $must_3 = ".Send:Execute("
        $must_4 = "http"
        $get = "GET"
        $post = "POST"
    condition:

    filesize < 10KB and all of ($must*) and ($get or $post)

}

objects.name: Analisi Malware: Devil Bait
objects.description: This report contains technical analysis and indicators associated with malware. devil bait.
